oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trabue's Brigade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Marker indicating the location of Trabue's Brigade in Shiloh, Tennessee.

This memorial in the Shiloh National Military Park commemorates Trabue's 1st Brigade Artillery (Army of the Mississippi), involved in the Battle of Shiloh. This memorial in the Shiloh National Military Park commemorates Trabue's 1st Brigade Artillery (Army of the Mississippi), involved in the Battle of Shiloh. The Battle of Shiloh was fought on 6 and 7 April 1862 by Union and Confederate forces during the American Civil War. Civil War Confederate Army Officer Robert P. Trabue. Known as "Old Trib", he raised and organized the 4th Kentucky (CSA) Infantry of the famous Kentucky "Orphan" Brigade during the War Between the States. He commanded the regiment until his death, also acting as Brigade commander at the Battle of Shiloh in April 1862. He commanded his regiment in the tragic attack of the Orphan Brigade at Murfreesboro, January 2, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments and memorials; National parks and reserves
